title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 September 2013 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
00:45 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki

07:34 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:43 <evalica> has quit  
07:46 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <mflorea> has quit  
09:26 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <sburjan> vmassol: good morning  
10:49 <vmassol> sburjan: hi  
10:49 <sburjan> vmassol: regarding the German translations e-mail, I think that you should reply to the thread, because I don't know exactly what to tell him, besides encouraging him to make more contributions :)  
10:49 <evalica> has quit  
10:50 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <camil7> sburjan: vmassol: no need to reply to me there, I hope just someone else reviews my typos ;)  
10:56 <camil7> must be some more German speakers in that list  
10:57 <sburjan> oh, hello camil7. Didn't know it was you :)  
10:57 <camil7> at least considering the bad English of some of the folks they are certainly native German speakers :D  
10:57 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <camil7> and yeah, I should not use that much different nicknames, so people better know who I am ...  
10:59 <sburjan> So if the translations are not reviewed, they won't be in the released version ? This is actually a question for vmassol  
11:01 <tmortagne> sburjan: they don't need to be reviewed to be included (we skipped that part since we don't have official reviewer and most translations are not really tagged as such)  
11:01 <camil7> to my experience they are in the release .... it is just that it would be better if someone else has a look  
11:02 <camil7> ah, tmortagne, beat me to it with a better qualified answer  
11:02 <sburjan> camil7. well IMO they can always be improved. I'd say it's better to have a full german translation (even with mistakes) than having .. none  
11:02 <tmortagne> sburjan: well it all depends how bad is the translation ;)  
11:03 <camil7> anyway, my post on the list was more an attempt to invite more people, considering a review for typos" easier than making the translation ...  
11:03 <tmortagne> but I'm sure if there is mistake here it will be small mistakes  
11:03 <tmortagne> and yes it's always better to have several people looking at translations  
11:04 <sburjan> yes, since camil7 is native german, he can't be that wrong about what he is doing  
11:04 <sburjan> and indeed, the more pair of eyes, the better, but we have to deal with what we have and still try to make progress  
11:05 <camil7> well, you never know ;)  ... for example in the DW I really thing the name of the buttons and the text explaining then should be better in sync  
11:05 <sburjan> camil7: nobody is stopping you to improve it. I'd help but my German skills are close to 0  
11:06 <camil7> well, I hope I come to the DW this evening ... unless I hang around too much in chat ;)  
11:06 <camil7> but now to something completely different:  a colleague of mine has a small pull request https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/145  
11:07 <camil7> that is for the following Solr improvment   XWIKI-9413  
11:07 <camil7> we tried to add a test for that, but it came out very clumsy  
11:07 <camil7> but maybe someone can look at it any? maybe tmortagne ?  
11:09 <tmortagne> camil7: sorry I totally skipped your mail, I will look at it ASAP  
11:10 <camil7> would be not me but "mkresse" in that case ... maybe I can try to drag him into chat if there is somethign to discuss  
11:10 <camil7> but thanks for looking into it!  
11:11 <vmassol> camil7: it's good to see you guys from espresto becoming active in the xwiki project :)  
11:12 <camil7>  yes, I hope we can keep it up at least for some while - high time we finally got to do something  
11:12 <camil7> btw using git to send patches helps a lot, making contributions much easier  
11:12 <vmassol> I'm sure some of you guys could become committers if you keep it up for a while :)  
11:13 <tmortagne> camil7: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/145 looks good, just one little suggestion  
11:13 <camil7> we will try to send more patches, it partially depends on with what our customers threaten us next  
11:14 <vmassol> :)  
11:14 <camil7> support for Arrays as been a bit painful, we thought  
11:15 <camil7> but ... yes, we can add that ... me going over to mkresse to see what he says  
11:15 <vmassol> not sure what you're referring to  
11:15 <vmassol> (re arrays)  
11:16 <vmassol> ah you're replying to tmortagne...  
11:16 <camil7> sorry, me commenting on the patch 145 comment of tmortagne  
11:16 <camil7> yes, maybe should comment in github instaed  ... channel confusion ;)  
11:17 <vmassol> or just prefix your mesage with tmortagne:  
11:17 <vmassol> if you want to talk just to tmortagne  
11:22 <tmortagne> camil7: java.lang.reflect.Array should help with arrays  
11:23 <tmortagne> (provide methods manipulate an array that you don't know)  
11:23 <camil7> yes, we just have not been sure of we should add yet another if-branch for arrays.  mkresse is busy with some urgent mail and will look into it instantly after that  
11:23 <camil7> s/of/if/  
11:25 <evalica1> has left #xwiki  
11:35 <tmortagne> camil7: if mkresse does not have time it's OK, it was just a suggestion  
11:36 <camil7> he should have time today ... at least for the Iterable, that is just a single word change :)  
11:36 <tmortagne> yep  
11:55 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <mflorea1> has quit  
13:11 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:11 <polx> has quit  
13:11 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
13:11 <polx> has quit  
13:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:36 <polx> has quit  
13:37 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <polx> has quit  
14:14 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <D-Spair> Hi all... I just stood up a brand new XWiki 5.1 Jetty install.  
14:26 <D-Spair> I have set the XWiki Rights such that no unauthorized users can view/edit pages, but now the logo from my Theme and my theme are not showing up for users who are not logged in... Can I make that work with page rights? If so, how?  
14:39 <D-Spair> NVM, I worked it out.  
14:40 <D-Spair> Next problem... User avatars/images... I keep getting an error: Could not initialize class sun.awt.X11GraphicsEnvironment when trying to view a user's image. Is this because I am not running with "-headless"?  
14:41 <msmeria> has quit  
14:42 <D-Spair> NVM, my assumption was right... Adding "-Djava.awt.headless=true" to the startup options fixed it...  
14:47 <polx> has quit  
14:50 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <D-Spair> has quit  
14:55 <vmassol> cjd: hi, any idea why http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-4287 wasn't applied? Now that you know more XWiki, do you think you could review it and verify it's still valid to be applied?  
15:11 <polx> has quit  
15:13 <martin\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <martin\_\_> is now known as <mkresse>  
15:21 <mkresse> tmortagne: I just updated pull request https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/145  
15:22 <tmortagne> mkresse: great, looking at it  
15:27 <tmortagne> mkresse: pull request merged and issue closed, thanks !  
15:35 <mkresse> tmortagne: thx for merging :-)  
15:40 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <vmassol> guys I'm finishing the fix for checkstyle in the activeinstalls branch and then I'll merge on master in about 1 hour  
15:43 <vmassol> (fyi)  
15:43 <vmassol> (and in case someone has a remark)  
15:44 <evalica> has quit  
15:46 <Denis> has quit  
15:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: any idea why our jobs stop at first failing test now ? they used to build everything  
15:48 <vmassol> no idea except that I upgraded jenkins a few days ago  
15:57 <tmortagne> forcing a complete build it actually seems related to the feature that partially build after a commit  
15:57 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <polx> has quit  
15:58 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
16:07 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <polx> has quit  
16:07 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
16:42 <vmassol> going to merge....  
16:46 <sburjan> has quit  
16:59 <vmassol> merge done  
16:59 <vmassol> hope I didn't break too many things ;)  
17:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: I think I will merge wiki stream on Monday  
17:20 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok  
17:32 <vmassol> [INFO] XWiki Platform - Panels - Tests - Functional Tests  FAILURE [1:26.746s]  
17:32 <vmassol> Tests in error:  
17:32 <vmassol>   PanelTest.limitPanelViewRight:86 ? ElementNotVisible Element is not currently ...  
17:32 <vmassol>   PanelTest.addPanelWithSpacesInName:57 ? ElementNotVisible Element is not curre...  
17:32 <vmassol> mflorea: do you have that too?  
17:33 <mflorea> yes, see my comment on Selenium upgrade jira issue  
17:34 <mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-442?focusedCommentId=77081&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-77081  
17:34 <vmassol> so we should revert?  
17:34 <mflorea> I haven't had the time to look for a workaround  
17:35 <mflorea> reverting prevents us from testing the latest Firefox versions  
17:35 <mflorea> I'd like to try to find a workaround but I have to finish with the search suggest first  
17:58 <mflorea> has quit

19:51 <Mariah> hello

20:15 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
20:27 <cjd> has quit  
20:29 <dirk\_schmitt> has joined #xwiki  
20:29 <dirk\_schmitt> has left #xwiki  
21:05 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
21:19 <Mariah> has quit  
22:31 <Mariah> has joined #xwiki  
22:31 <Mariah> hello  
22:31 <Mariah> somebody can help?  
22:39 <vmassol> has quit  
23:03 <polx> Hello XWiki community,  
23:04 <polx> Does anyone know if a skin can be allocated to a browser when first hitting the server? E.g. in a cookie?  
23:07 <polx> Mariah: is that your question? Somebody knows if its possible show a space only to an user?  
23:11 <polx> @Mariah, if yes, I think you want rights (in Administer Space), with the prohibition to read for everyone and the allowance to read for that user.  
23:20 <Mariah> thanks  
23:21 <Mariah> i got a problem  
23:23 <Mariah> I have a space that only registered users can view all goes well but from the panel "recently created" you can see the information, even not being a registered user  
23:23 <Mariah> it´s a bug?  
23:24 <polx> I think it is. I've had that. But not always.  
23:25 <polx> Have you considered the users mailing-list?  
23:46 <Mariah> how can do that?  
23:47 <Mariah> i find this  
23:47 <Mariah> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+hide+a+space+for+some+users  
23:47 <Mariah> but it is not what I want  
23:48 <Mariah> in theory, unregistered users should be able to see the section, but if you know the URL from the browser, you can see the information even when supposedly, protected
